title: After Another Mass Shooting, Questions Loom About the Role of Parents

title: Inside a Uvalde Classroom: A Taunting Gunman and 78 Minutes of Terror
abstract: A teacher who survived the mass shooting recounts the harrowing attack and desperate wait for a rescue.

title: ‘I Felt Trapped’: Sexual Abuse of Teens in the Military’s J.R.O.T.C. Program
abstract: Former students say military veterans who led J.R.O.T.C. classes in U.S. high schools fashioned themselves as mentors, then used their power to manipulate and abuse.
byline: By Mike Baker, Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs, Ilana Marcus and Mary F. Calvert
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

title: Justice Jackson, a Former Law Clerk, Returns to a Transformed Supreme Court
abstract: In the 22 years since she worked for Justice Stephen G. Breyer, whom she replaced last month, the court has become polarized and predictably conservative.

title: As the Planet Cooks, Climate Stalls as a Political Issue
abstract: Joe Manchin’s rejection of a compromise climate bill tells a familiar story: Voters and politicians put a higher premium on immediate issues, such as inflation and the economy, giving politicians a pass on global warming.
byline: By Jonathan Weisman and Jazmine Ulloa

title: What New Abortion Bans Mean for the Youngest Patients
abstract: One 10-year-old became the focus of debate, but more than 1,000 girls under 15 seek abortions each year. “How are we going to help the pregnant kids?”

multimedia.caption: New abortion bans in nearly a dozen states do not make exceptions for rape or incest, leaving young adolescents with less access to the procedure.

title: Little-Known Lawyer Pitched Trump on Extreme Plans to Subvert Election
